arts.ttl: Hull City rocked by more concerning injury news as Derby County lie in wait
arts.sum: There was also bad news on the injury front with Marvin Mehlem, who missed the MKM Stadium clash with the Clarets with a calf injury, and will be sidelined until after the international break, joining Steven Alzate in suffering a similar issue. German midfielder Mehlem will be sidelined until City return from the international break in mid-November, as he nurses a calf problem similar to the one keeping new signing Steven Alzate sidelined.

arts.ttl: Tim Walter makes Hull City confession after Burnley draw
arts.sum: Tim Walter admits he's learned his lesson after watching Hull City held to a 1-1 draw by promotion hopefuls Burnley at the MKM Stadium on Wednesday evening. In the end, it's more the pride about how we played, especially after the loss against Sunderland.

arts.ttl: Scott Parker's immediate reaction to Burnley's draw against Hull City as unbeaten run continues
arts.sum: Scott Parker was left with mixed feelings after his Burnley side battled back from behind to draw with Hull City and extend their unbeaten run.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings vs Burnley as Gustavo Puerta and Charlie Hughes shine
arts.sum: City were good value for a half-time lead given to them by Xavier Simons' strike right on the stroke of the break, when he crashed an effort past the stranded James Trafford to open his account for the club. A late Zian Flemming goal denied Hull City a rare victory against Burnley, with the Tigers forced to settle for a point in a 1-1 draw at the MKM Stadium.

arts.ttl: Zian Flemming rescues Burnley a point at Hull
arts.sum: Xavier Simons had opened the scoring for the Tigers with a deflected strike.

arts.ttl: Gritty Hull City show courage in battling draw with high-flying Burnley
arts.sum: City defended well for much of the second period until an unfortunate skip from skipper Lewie Coyle allowed Jaidon Anthony to cross for Zian Flemming to head into the net at the back post with 13 minutes left, and had to survive a heart-stopping scare deep in added time to hold on for their point. That all changed on the stroke of half-time when Kamara and the excellent Puerta combined to allow Simons to fizz a shot from 20 yards past Trafford, leaving the Clarets stopper befuddled, giving City the lead their promising first half display deserved.

arts.ttl: Hull City 1-1 Burnley: Zian Flemming's first goal maintains Clarets' unbeaten run
arts.sum: Zian Flemming grabbed his first Burnley goal as Scott Parker’s men extended their unbeaten run with a draw against Hull City.

arts.ttl: Scott Parker freshens up his Burnley side for Hull City test as Humphreys and Laurent drop out
arts.sum: Scott Parker has stayed true to his word and freshened up his Burnley side for tonight’s trip to Hull City.

arts.ttl: Hull City attacker could return to training next week amid new injury update
arts.sum: Hull City boss Tim Walter has said Ryan Longman is ‘getting better’ and he could return to training… The post Hull City attacker could return to training next week amid new injury update appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: What we learnt from Hull City's first 10 Championship games as mistakes leave no hiding place
arts.sum: The ten-game point of any season is where progress is often assessed, and Hull City reached that on Sunday afternoon when they were narrowly beaten 1-0 by Sunderland for the second successive campaign. City’s three wins all came against teams in poor form, and the four defeats have come - without scoring a goal - against teams higher than them in the table, so perhaps that gives an indication of how the season may play out in what looks increasingly like one of transition.
